page.title: 04LOGANAIR
page.content: {Loganair is a Scottish airline {company.}It operates{inter-island services in Orkney, Shetland and the Western Isles. The{'Islander' planes are twin-engined and can take nine passengers and one pilot. They also carry mail and luggage. They are used for business and pleasure. People using the plane include teachers, flying from the Mainland of Orkney, the vet, bankers, visitors, and patients attending clinics at the Balfour Hospital. Loganair also provides ambulance flights. The air journey from{Kirkwall to Sanday}takes about{eleven minutes}compared to 1 hour 45 minutes by boat. The plane comes in twice a day but not on Sundays. Fog is the greatest problem for the inter-island service.
